title:
Continuous-variable designs and design-based shadow tomography from
  random lattices
authors:
Jonathan Conrad, Joseph T. Iosue, Ansgar G. Burchards, Victor V.
  Albert
abstract:
We investigate state designs for continuous-variable quantum systems using
the aid of lattice-like quantum states. These are code states of
Gottesman-Kitaev-Preskill (GKP) codes. We show that for an n-mode system, the
set of all GKP states forms a rigged continuous-variable state 2-design. We use
these lattice state designs to construct a continuous variable shadow
tomography protocol, derive sample complexity bounds for both global- and local
GKP shadows under reasonable physical assumptions, and provide the physical
gadgets needed to implement this protocol.
